ev3dev.sensors

Class EV3Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • ev3dev.sensors.EV3Key

  • public class EV3Key
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the Key interface for EV3. The easiest way to get an instance of this class is to use one of the static constants of the Button class.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Returns the ID of this key.
        Returns:
        one of the BUTTON_* constants

      • isDown

        public boolean isDown()
        A non-blocking check of whether this key is currently pressed. This is
        Returns:
        true for pressed, false otherwise

      • isUp

        public boolean isUp()
        A non-blocking check of whether this key is currently released.
        Returns:
        true for released, false otherwise

      • waitForPress

        public void waitForPress()
        A blocking call that will return once this key gets pressed. This method returns immediately if this key is pressed already.

      • waitForPressAndRelease

        public void waitForPressAndRelease()
        A blocking call that will first wait for this key being pressed and then it waits for this key being released. Unlike waitForPress(), this method will always block because this key cannot be already pressed and released at the same time. At the least, this key will be pressed so this method will only wait for it to be released.

      • addKeyListener

        public void addKeyListener(KeyListener keyListener)
        Adds a listener for this key's 'pressed' and 'released' events. If this is the Button.ALL key, the listener will be getting notifications for any key events.
        Parameters:
        keyListener -

      • removeKeyListener

        public void removeKeyListener(KeyListener keyListener)
        Removes the given key event listener.
        Parameters:
        keyListener -

      • simulateEvent

        public void simulateEvent(int i)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this key.
        Returns:
        e.g. "LEFT" or "ENTER"
